item.title: Rubbish from bin bags (ripped by foxes) on pavement, 10th December
item.description:
Bin bags left out at the front of the alley beside the town hall have been ripped open by foxes. Whilst the bags have been removed there is quite a lots of rubbish and mess left on the pavement area that needs cleaning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Bromley Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes Harwood Avenue, 10th December
item.description:
There are several potholes which are dangerous to cyclists, both at the beginning and the end of Harwood Avenue. I hit the pothole near Nr 57 while cycling in the dark, none of the potholes are very visible esp if they are between the light from the lampposts.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harwood Avenue, Plaistow, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 10th December
item.description:
This has been dumped on the balcony of page House for around a week, not only is it unsightly it is also a fire hazard and a health and safety hazard. It has been left against a drain pipe where the continuous pressure could cause issues. This is against the tenant policy which states that communal areas should be free from rubbish.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Welland Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter left and not cleaned, 10th December
item.description:
I am a resident in Kelsey road and cut through the alley way from pleasance road into Sevenoaks ways opposite Essex petrol garage. The litter has been there for weeks please can someone tidy this area, I would also like to recommend putting a bin at one of the ends as this may help. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Pleasance Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole / missing drain cap, 10th December
item.description:
Patient came into the pharmacy saying she had fallen down a pothole in this area , damaged her leg and knee. Patient asked pharmacy to inform someone of the issue. Exact location is unknown although we have advised patient to make her own request via this channel.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thames Reach, Greater London

item.title: Outside Dene Mansions, Kingdon Road NW6 1QU, 10th December
item.description:
Although the road works to fix the leak in Kingdon Road appear to have been completed and the trench has been closed, an area in the road outside Dene Mansions has been cordoned off and (folded) barriers and cones have been left, taking up a parking space.

item.title: Boot scrapper worn out, 10th December
item.description:
Reported brush on boot scrapper needed replacing bacl in the summer. It is even worse now..no bristles at all and completely overgrown. This is at entrance by Riverside Road (opposite Betterton Drive). Can you please replace this. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 98, Riverside Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
